result.execSummary:
The defendant Marques Deshay Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution set at $500.00 payable to B.A.H.

Provide DNA sample. Pay all supervision fees, court costs, fees and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation. Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment. Court waived non-mandatory COSTS/FEES.

Court advised defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

- No New Law Violations raising to the level of probable cause.
- No driving without a valid driver's license or insurance.
- NO CONTACT with Enterprise Rent-A-Car, B.A.H., R.V., J.S.M., R.F.R. and R.V.
- NO CONTACT with firearms.

- Cooperate with DOC Agent.
- Mental Health Evaluation; comply with recommended treatment.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

- AODA assessment; comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety; Random UA.

Defendant Marques Deshay Johnson in court with attorney Christian Thomas.  Defendant Marques Deshay Johnson in custody.  William R. F Ackell appeared on behalf of Stephan Eduard Nolten for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Sentencing hearing . State complied with Victim Notification. Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant. Additional Statements by: Charlton D. 

AS TO COUNT 1, COUNT 2 and COUNT 3 :  
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 42  MONTHS, Concurrent to Case 21CF4790 and 21CF2149 , with credit for 20 DAYS time served. 
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 18 MONTHS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  

AS TO COUNT 4 :  
Court sentenced the Defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of SIX YEARS, Concurrent to Case 21CF4790 and 21CF2149 , with credit for 20 DAYS time served. 
The term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is THREE (3) YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is THREE (3) YEARS. 

Court found Defendant IS  ELIGIBLE for the Challenge Incarceration Program. 
Court found Defendant IS  ELIGIBLE for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program. 

If defendant successfully completes the Challenge Incarceration Program and/or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program Court will release Defendant within 30 days of notification. Remaining Initial Confinement time will be converted to extended supervision.
 
COURT IMPOSED AND STAYED THE SENTENCE ON COUNT 1, COUNT 2, COUNT 3 and COUNT 4, AND PLACED DEFENDANT ON PROBATION FOR A PERIOD OF THREE (3) YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction as Condition Time as to COUNT 1, COUNT 2, COUNT 3 and COUNT 4, STAYED pending review, Concurrent to Case 22CF1557 and 21CF2149;
-No New Law Violations raising to the level of Probable Cause.
-Cooperate with DOC Agent.
-Mental health evaluation, comply with recommended treatment;
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment;
-Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent;
-Absolute sobriety; Random UA 
-Obtain a valid driver's license
-No driving without a valid driver's license or insurance.
-Obtain GED
-No contact with Enterprise Rent- A-Car, B.A.H. , R.V., J.S.M., R.F.R and R.V.
-No contact with firearms;
-Provide DNA sample;
-Pay all supervision fees, court costs, fees, and surcharges including: DNA & DV surcharges during period of probation.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment;  
-Court orders restitution set at $500.00 payable to B.A.H. 

Court Waived Non-Mandatory COSTS/FEES, .

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 
Court advised Defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

FILED: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation and Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  

Probation review hearing in Branch 45.
 Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.

Defendant Marques Deshay Johnson in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared on behalf of Stephan Eduard Nolten for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Plea (or Plea/Sentencing) hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State complied with Victim Notification. Plea hearing proceeded. Negotiations placed on the record, and confirmed by Defense and Defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1, 2, 3 and 4: 
Defendant changed his plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to the plea, and advised of Constitutional Rights and maximum penalties. Defendant advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found Defendant knowingly, voluntarily, and intelligently waived all his rights. Parties stipulated to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis for the plea. Court found Defendant GUILTY as charged in the Information, and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction. 

Court advised Defendant that he is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, or body armor. 
Court advised Defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored. 

FILED: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum, and Elements of the Offense/Jury Instructions.

Notice of Ineligible Voting Rights, received and filed.
-received and filed.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Marques D Johnson not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is requesting substitution of attorney, written stipulation and order to be filed. Case is adjourned in Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marques Deshay Johnson in court with Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask; both appear by video.  Defendant Marques Deshay Johnson in custody.  Annie Louk appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 45.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
SPD Order Appointing Counsel, Filed
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:
Any Enterprise Rent-A-Car in Milwaukee County

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Marques Deshay Johnson in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Marques Deshay Johnson in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Marques Deshay Johnson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised that due to lower pending cases, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
